gurmukhi: BUl prXo pRB mY Gt kwm kIXo qum so ju pY ju`D chXo ] qo khw BXo jo irs Awie iBrXO qu khw ieh TwN myro mwn rhXo ]
transliteration: Bhool Daryo Prabh Mai Ghat Kaam Keeyo Toum So Ju Pai Juddh Chadyo|| To Kahaa Bhayo Jo Ris Aae Bhiryau Tu Kahaa Eh Thaan Mero Maan Rahyo||
translation: “O Lord ! I have executed a very mean task in thinking of fighting with you; what ! if I fought with you in my fury, but you have shattered my pride at this place;

gurmukhi: qumry gun gwvq hI shs Pin Aau cqurwnn hwr rhXo ] qumry gun kaun gnY kh lau ijh byd skY nih Byd khXo ]2236]
transliteration: Toumre Goun Gadvat Hisahas Phan(i) Au Chaturaanan Haar Rahyo|| Toumre Goun Kaoun Gadai Kah Lau Jih Bed Sakai Nah(i) Bhed Kahyo||2236||
translation: Sheshnaga and Brahma have become tired of praising you; to what extent your virtues may be described? Because the Vedas could not completely describe your secret.”2236.

gurmukhi: kw BXo jo Dr mUMf jtw su qpo Dn ko jg ByK idKwXo ] kw BXo jo kaU locn mUMd BlI ibD soN hir ky gun gwXo ]
transliteration: Kaa Bhayo Jo Dhar Moondd Jataa Su Tapo Dhan Ko Jag Bhekh Dikhaayo|| Kaa Bado Jo Kaoo Lochanndmoondd Bhalibidh Son Har(i) Ke Goun Gadyo||
translation: What then, if someone roamed wearing matted locks and adopting different guises; closing his eyes and singing the Praises of the Lord,

gurmukhi: Aaur khw jU pY AwrqI lY kir jgwie kY sMK bjwXo ] sXwm khY qum hI n kho ibn pRym ikhU biRjnwiek pwXo ]2237]
transliteration: Aur Kahaa Joo Pai Aaritilai Kar(i) Jagade Kai Sankh Bajaayo|| Syaam Kahai Toum Hina Kaho Bin Prem Kihoo Brijnaaik Paayo||2237||
translation: And performing your aarti (circumambulation) by burning the incenses and blowing the conches; buy the poet Shyam says that without love one cannot realise God, the hero of Braja.2237.

gurmukhi: iqau cqurwnn iqauhU shswnn hI gun gwXo ] nwrd s`kR sdw iSv bXws ieqo gun sXwm ko gwie sunwXo ]
transliteration: Tio Chaturaanan Tio-hoo Sahsaanan Higoun Gadyo|| Naarad Sakkra Sadaa Shiv Byaas Ito Goun Syaam Ko Gade Sounaayo||
translation: Brahma, Kartikeya, Sheshnaga, Narada, Indra, Shiva, Vyasa etc, all are singing the praise of God;

gurmukhi: cwro eI byd n Byd lhXo jg Kojq hY sB pwr n pwXo ] sXwm BnY qum hI n kho ibn pRym ikhU biRjnwQ irJwXo ]2238]
transliteration: Chdaro Ibed Na Bhed Lahyo Jag Khojat Hai Sabh Paar Na Paayo|| Syaam Bhanai Toum Hina Kaho Bin Prem Kihoo Brijnaath Rijhaayo||2238||
translation: All the four Vedas, seeking Him, have not been able to comprehend His mystery; the poet Sham says, tell me whether without love, someone has been able to please that Lord of Braja.2238.
Speech of Shiva addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: pwie prXo iSv jU hir ky khXo mo ibnqI hir jU sun lIjY ] syvk mwNgq hY bru eyk vhY Ab rIJ dieAwinD dIjY ]
transliteration: Paae Daryo Shiv Joo Har(i) Ke Kahyo Mo Bintihar(i) Joo Soun Leejai|| Sevak Maanad Hai Bar(u) Ek Vahai Ab Reejh Daiaanidh Deejai||
translation: Shiva said, holding the feet of Krishna, “O Lord! listen to my request; this servant of your is asking for a boon; kindly bestow on me the same;

gurmukhi: hyr hmY kib sXwm BnY kbhU krunw rs ky sMg BIjY ] bwhY ktI shsRwBuj kI qu Blo qh ko Ab nwsu n kIjY ]2239]
transliteration: Her Hamai Kabi Syaam Bhanai Kab-hoo Karounaa Ras Ke San Bheejai|| Baahai Katisahsraabhuj Kitu Bhalo Tah Ko Ab Naas(u) Na Keejai||2239||
translation: “O Lord ! looking towards me, mercifully, give your consent not to kill Sahasrabahu, though his arms have been chopped.”2239.
